basics.name: John Dos
basics.label: Software Master
basics.summary: Software engineer who ships reliable systems, trims latency, and writes tests because future-me has already suffered enough. I like clean APIs, boring infrastructure, and documentation that doesn't gaslight people. If it's slow, flaky, or unclear, I'll probably fix it (and add a postmortem template while I'm at it).

work.name: Big Corporation Name Inc.
work.summary: Built UI features that didn't just *look* fast, they *were* fast. Turned unclear product ideas into accessible, measurable, and maintainable interfaces. Reduced regressions by introducing component contracts, visual checks, and a healthy fear of Fridays.
highlights: Cut cold-start time and improved responsiveness through code-splitting, caching, and sensible bundling.
Introduced reusable UI patterns and tooling that made the design system actually usable (wild concept).
Improved error reporting and triage so bugs stopped living rent-free in 'we'll fix later'.

work.name: Famous Eshop Inc.
work.summary: Worked across backend, frontend, and database layers for an e-commerce platform. Focused on reliability, performance, and boring stability. Helped keep checkout flowing, inventory consistent, and on-call sleep mostly intact.
highlights: Optimized database queries and reduced operational incidents by eliminating slow hotspots.
Built internal tooling for ops and support that reduced manual work and improved auditability.
Implemented safer deploy practices (versioning, rollbacks, and less YOLO).

work.name: example.com
work.summary: Learned the craft the honest way: fixing bugs, reading other people's code, and discovering that 'quick fix' is a time bomb with a longer fuse than you think.
highlights: Implemented features and bug fixes with attention to maintainability and basic security hygiene.
Wrote documentation and handoffs so knowledge didn't vanish when someone went on vacation.

education.summary: Graduate studies focused on software engineering, distributed systems fundamentals, and the ancient art of explaining complexity to humans.
Exchange semester with emphasis on systems thinking, collaboration, and learning to debug in a different timezone.
Foundation in programming, databases, and architecture, plus the real curriculum: group projects.

references.name: Jane Doe
references.reference: This man knows what he's doing. He's a great developer. I highly recommend him.

references.name: Jeanine Doe
references.reference: I've worked with this man for years. He's been such a talented developer. I highly recommend him.
